put.summary: Update the attendances for multiple appointments
put.description:
Update the attendance records for attendees on multiple appointments. This sets the current attendance records
    for the supplied prison numbers, replacing any existing records. This supports both the initial recording of attendances
    and changing that attendance records. There are no restrictions on when attendances can be recorded. It can be done
    for past and future appointments.
    

Requires one of the following roles:
* PRISON
* ACTIVITY_ADMIN

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: How to mark the attendance records.

schema.description: The lists of prison numbers to mark as attended and non-attended

204.description: Attendance for the appointment was recorded.

401.description: Unauthorised, requires a valid Oauth2 token

post.summary: Get a list of scheduled events for a prison and list of prisoner numbers for a date and time slot
post.description:
Returns scheduled events for the prison, prisoner numbers, single date and an optional time slot.
      Court hearings, adjudication hearings, transfers and visits come from NOMIS (via prison API).
      Activities and appointments come from either NOMIS or the local database depending on whether the prison is
      marked as rolled-out for activities and/or appointments.
      (Intended usage: Unlock list)
    

Requires one of the following roles:
* PRISON
* ACTIVITY_ADMIN

parameters.name: prisonCode
parameters.description: The 3-character prison code.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The exact date to return events for (required) in format YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: timeSlot
parameters.description: Time slot of the events (optional). If supplied, one of AM, PM or ED.

200.description: Successful call - zero or more scheduled events found

401.description: Unauthorised, requires a valid Oauth2 token

404.description: Requested resource not found

post.summary: Get a list of scheduled events for a prison and list of internal location ids numbers for a date and optional time slot
post.description:
Returns scheduled events for the prison, internal location ids, single date and an optional time slot.
      This endpoint only returns activities and appointments and these come from the local database.
      This endpoint supports the creation of movement lists.
      Note that activities are only scheduled 60 days in advance. Appointments may be scheduled for any date in the future.
    

Requires one of the following roles:
* PRISON
* ACTIVITY_ADMIN

parameters.name: prisonCode
parameters.description: The 3-character prison code.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The exact date to return events for (required) in format YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: timeSlot
parameters.description: Time slot of the events (optional). If supplied, one of AM, PM or ED.

schema.description: Set of internal location ids (required). Example [123, 456].

200.description: Successful call - zero or more scheduled events found

401.description: Unauthorised, requires a valid Oauth2 token

404.description: Requested resource not found

post.summary: Get a list of scheduled events for a prison given list of DPS location UUIDs, a date and optional time slot
post.description:
Returns scheduled events for the prison, locations UUIDs, date and optional time slot.
      This endpoint only returns activities and appointments and these come from the local database.
      This endpoint supports the creation of movement lists.
      Note that activities are only scheduled 60 days in advance. Appointments may be scheduled for any date in the future.
    

Requires one of the following roles:
* PRISON
* ACTIVITY_ADMIN

parameters.name: prisonCode
parameters.description: The 3-character prison code.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The exact date to return events for (required) in format YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: timeSlot
parameters.description: Time slot of the events (optional). If supplied, one of AM, PM or ED.

schema.description: Set of internal DPS Locations UUIDS (required). Example [b7602cc8-e769-4cbb-8194-62d8e655992a, e284603a-73cb-4892-a4c8-79cf9da199df].

200.description: Successful call - zero or more scheduled events found

401.description: Unauthorised, requires a valid Oauth2 token

404.description: Requested resource not found

post.summary: Move the start date for activities their schedules and allocations for a prison
post.description:
Move a prisons activities to a later start date.
      Only allocations due to start before the new start date will be moved.
      Activities that have already started will be ignored.
      Activities that are not before the new start date will be ignored.
    

Requires one of the following roles:
* NOMIS_ACTIVITIES
* ACTIVITY_ADMIN

parameters.name: activityStartDate
parameters.description: The new activity start date for the activities. Must be in the future.

200.description: The start dates have been updated where possible

post.summary: Trigger the job to generate purposeful activity reports and upload to s3
post.description:
Generates 3 csv reports which are uploaded to an s3 bucket for prison performance reporting team to process for
      purposeful activity generation purposes and to display on the prison regime dashboard in the performance hub.

      Report 1) Details of attended purposeful-activity activities
      Report 2) Details of attended purposeful-activity appointments
      Report 3) Prison rollout table

      Can only be accessed from within the ingress. Requests from elsewhere will result in a 401 response code.

parameters.name: weekOffset
parameters.description: Report is calculated for the week up to the prior saturday. increase offset to generate reports for weeks prior to that

post.summary: Trigger the job to manage attendance records in advance
post.description: Can only be accessed from within the ingress. Requests from elsewhere will result in a 401 response code.

parameters.name: prisonCode
parameters.description: If supplied will create attendance records for the given rolled out prison.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: If supplied will create attendance records for the given date. Default to the current date.

parameters.name: withExpiry
parameters.description: If true will run the attendance expiry process in addition to other features. Defaults to false.

post.summary: Trigger the job to manage allocations
post.description:
One or more operations to trigger for managing allocations.

        Can only be accessed from within the ingress. Requests from elsewhere will result in a 401 response code.

parameters.name: withActivate
parameters.description: If true will run the activate pending allocations process. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: withDeallocateEnding
parameters.description: If true will run the deallocate allocations that are ending process. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: withDeallocateExpiring
parameters.description: If true will run the deallocate allocations that are expiring process. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: withFixAutoSuspended
parameters.description: If true will attempt to unsuspend auto suspended prisoners who should have been received back into the prison already.

post.summary: Trigger the job fix activity and appointment locations
post.description: Can only be accessed from within the ingress. Requests from elsewhere will result in a 401 response code.

post.summary: Trigger the job to create the scheduled instances in advance for the active schedules on activities
post.description: Can only be accessed from within the ingress. Requests from elsewhere will result in a 401 response code.

post.summary: Starts a job to manage appointment attendees
post.description:
Job will retrieve all future appointments starting within the number of days defined by the days after now parameter.
      It will retrieve the attendees for these appointments and retrieve the associated prisoner records. The status, location and
      any other pertinent information for these prisoners will be used to determine whether the attendee records should be removed.
      
      Can only be accessed from within the ingress. Requests from elsewhere will result in a 401 response code.

parameters.name: daysAfterNow
parameters.description: The number of days into the future to manage appointments up to a maximum of 60. The attendees for future appointments starting on those days this will be managed.

post.summary: Trigger the job to generate appointments metrics
post.description: Can only be accessed from within the ingress. Requests from elsewhere will result in a 401 response code.

get.summary: Get a list of internal locations that have events scheduled to take place on the specified date and optional time slot.
get.description:
Returns internal locations that have events scheduled to take place on the specified date and optional time slot.
      Will contain summary information about the events taking place at the location as well as the total number of
      prisoners due to arrive at the location. This endpoint supports the creation of movement lists allowing
      users to select from a sublist of only the internal locations that have events scheduled there.
      Note that activities are only scheduled 60 days in advance. Appointments may be scheduled for any date in the future.
    

Requires one of the following roles:
* PRISON
* ACTIVITY_ADMIN

delete.description:
Deletes an activity and all its child entities including schedule, slots, pay, instances, attendances and allocations.
      Only for use via by migration services to undo a failed migration.
      

Requires one of the following roles:
* NOMIS_ACTIVITIES

parameters.description: The prison code where this activity exists

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: The activity ID to remove

401.description: Unauthorised, requires a valid Oauth2 token

delete.summary:
Starts a job to delete migrated appointments taking place at the supplied prison code that start on or after the
      supplied start date and are assigned the optional category code.
delete.description:
Migrated appointments matching the supplied criteria will be soft deleted in the database. An appointment instance
      deleted domain event used for syncing will be published for each deleted appointment. This will cause the mapped
      appointment in NOMIS to also be deleted.
    

Requires one of the following roles:
* NOMIS_APPOINTMENTS
* ACTIVITY_ADMIN
* MIGRATE_APPOINTMENTS

parameters.name: prisonCode
parameters.description: The 3-digit prison code.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Inclusive start date of migrated appointments to be deleted. Must be today or in the future

parameters.name: categoryCode
parameters.description: The category code assigned to migrated appointments to be deleted.

202.description: Migrated appointments matching the supplied criteria are being deleted.

401.description: Unauthorised, requires a valid Oauth2 token

AddCaseNoteRequest.description: Describes a case note to be added to a prisoner's profile

text.description: The text which will appear on the case note.

prisonerNumbers.description: The prisoner or prisoners to be deallocated. Must be allocated to the schedule affected by the request.

reasonCode.description: The reason code for the deallocation

endDate.description: The future date on which this allocation will end. Must not exceed the end date of the allocation, schedule or activity.

caseNote.description: Describes a case note to be added to the prisoner's profile as part of the deallocation.

scheduleInstanceId.description: The scheduled instance id required when de-allocation is a session later today

ScheduledInstancedUpdateRequest.description: The update request with the scheduled instance changes

cancelledReason.description: The reason for cancelling the schedule instance

comment.description: A field for any additional comments

issuePayment.description: Should payment be issued? Will be ignored if the activity is unpaid.

UncancelScheduledInstanceRequest.description: The uncancel request with the user details

username.description: The username of the user performing the unschedule operation

displayName.description: The displayName of the user performing the unschedule operation

scheduleInstanceIds.description: The scheduled instance ids to uncancel
The scheduled instance ids to cancel

reason.description: The reason for cancelling the schedule instances

username.description: The username of the user cancelling the schedule instances

comment.description: A field for any additional comments

issuePayment.description: Should payment be issued? Will be ignored if the activity is unpaid.

AttendanceUpdateRequest.description: Request object for updating an attendance record

id.description: The internally-generated ID for this attendance

prisonCode.description: The prison code

attendanceReason.description: The reason codes- SICK, REFUSED, NOT_REQUIRED, REST, CLASH, OTHER, SUSPENDED, CANCELLED, ATTENDED

comment.description: Comments such as more detail for SICK

issuePayment.description: Should payment be issued for SICK, REST or OTHER. Will be ignored if the activity is unpaid.

caseNote.example: Prisoner refused to attend the scheduled activity without reasonable excuse

incentiveLevelWarningIssued.description: Was an incentive level warning issued for REFUSED

otherAbsenceReason.example: Prisoner has another reason for missing the activity

AppointmentUncancelRequest.description: The uncancel request with the uncancellation details and how to apply the uncancellation

applyTo.description:
Specifies which appointment or appointments this un-cancellation should apply to.
    Defaults to THIS_APPOINTMENT meaning the un-cancellation will be applied to the appointment specified by the
    supplied id only.

Appointment.description:
Described on the UI as an "Appointment" and represents the scheduled event on a specific date and time.
  All updates and cancellations happen at this appointment level with the parent appointment series being immutable.

id.description: The internally generated identifier for this appointment

sequenceNumber.description: The sequence number of this appointment within the appointment series

prisonCode.description: The NOMIS AGENCY_LOCATIONS.AGY_LOC_ID value for mapping to NOMIS

categoryCode.description: The NOMIS REFERENCE_CODES.CODE (DOMAIN = 'INT_SCH_RSN') value for mapping to NOMIS

tier.description: The tier for this appointment, as defined by the Future Prison Regime team

customName.description:
Free text name further describing the appointment. Used as part of the appointment name with the
    format "Custom name (Category description) if specified.

internalLocationId.description:
The NOMIS AGENCY_INTERNAL_LOCATIONS.INTERNAL_LOCATION_ID value for mapping to NOMIS.
    Will be null if in cell = true

dpsLocationId.description: The optional DPS location UUID for this appointment

inCell.description:
Flag to indicate if the location of the appointment is in cell rather than an internal prison location.
    Internal location id should be null if in cell = true

startDate.description: The date this appointment is taking place on

startTime.description: The starting time of this appointment

endTime.description: The end time of this appointment

extraInformation.description:
Extra information for the prisoner or prisoners attending this appointment.
    Shown only on the appointments details page and on printed movement slips. Wing staff will be notified there is
    extra information via the unlock list.
extraInformation.example: This appointment will help adjusting to life outside of prison

prisonerExtraInformation.description:
Prisoner extra information for the prisoner or prisoners attending the appointment or appointments.
    Shown only on the appointments details page and on printed movement slips. Wing staff will be notified there is
    prisoner extra information via the unlock list.

createdTime.description: The date and time this appointment was created. Will not change

createdBy.description:
The username of the user authenticated via HMPPS auth that created the appointment.
    Usually a NOMIS username

updatedTime.description:
The date and time this appointment was last changed.
    Will be null if this appointment has not been altered since it was created

updatedBy.description:
The username of the user authenticated via HMPPS auth that edited this appointment.
    Will be null if this appointment has not been altered since it was created

cancelledTime.description:
The date and time this appointment was cancelled.
    Will be null if this appointment has not been cancelled

cancellationReasonId.description:
The id of the reason why this appointment was cancelled.
    Will be null if this appointment has not been cancelled

cancelledBy.description:
The username of the user authenticated via HMPPS auth that cancelled this appointment.
    Will be null if this appointment has not been cancelled

isDeleted.description: Indicates that this appointment has been deleted and removed from scheduled events.

attendees.description:
The prisoner or prisoners attending this appointment. Single appointments such as medical will have one
    attendee. A group appointment e.g. gym or chaplaincy sessions will have more than one attendee.
    Attendees are at the appointment level supporting alteration of attendees in any future appointment.

AppointmentAttendee.description: Described on the UI as an "Attendee". A prisoner attending a specific appointment in an appointment series or set.

id.description:
The internally generated identifier for this prisoner attending a specific appointment in an appointment series or set.
    N.B. this is used as the appointment instance id due to there being a one to one relationship between an appointment
    attendee and appointment instances.

prisonerNumber.description: The NOMIS OFFENDERS.OFFENDER_ID_DISPLAY value for mapping to a prisoner record in NOMIS

bookingId.description: The NOMIS OFFENDER_BOOKINGS.OFFENDER_BOOK_ID value for mapping to a prisoner booking record in NOMIS

addedTime.description:
The date and time this attendee was added appointment.
    Will be null if this attendee was part of the appointment when the appointment was created

addedBy.description:
The username of the user authenticated via HMPPS auth that added this attendee to the appointment.
    Will be null if this attendee was part of the appointment when the appointment was created

attended.description:
Specifies whether the prisoner attended the specific appointment in an appointment series or set.
    A null value means that the prisoner's attendance has not been recorded yet.

attendanceRecordedTime.description:
The latest date and time attendance was recorded. Note that attendance records can be updated and this is the most
    recent date and time it was recorded. A null value means that the prisoner's attendance has not been recorded yet.

attendanceRecordedBy.description:
The username of the user authenticated via HMPPS auth that last recorded attendance. Note that attendance records
    can be updated and this is the most recent user that marked attendance. A null value means that the prisoner's
    attendance has not been recorded yet.

removedTime.description:
The date and time this attendee was removed from the appointment.
    Will be null if this attendee has not been removed from the appointment

removalReasonId.description:
The id of the reason why this attendee was removed from the appointment.
    Will be null if this attendee has not been removed from the appointment

removedBy.description:
The username of the user authenticated via HMPPS auth that removed this attendee from the appointment.
    Will be null if this attendee has not been removed from the appointment

AppointmentSeries.description:
Described on the UI as an "Appointment series" and only shown for repeat appointments.
  The top level of the standard appointment hierarchy containing the initial property values common to all appointments
  in the series.
  Contains the collection of all the child appointments in the series plus the schedule definition if the appointment series repeats.
  The properties at this level cannot be changed via the API however the child appointment property values can be changed
  independently to support rescheduling, cancelling and altered attendee lists per appointment.
  N.B. there is no collection of attending prisoners at this top level as all attendees are per appointment. This is to
  support attendee modification for each scheduled appointment and to prevent altering the past by editing attendees
  in an appointment series where some appointments have past.

id.description: The internally generated identifier for this appointment series

prisonCode.description: The NOMIS AGENCY_LOCATIONS.AGY_LOC_ID value for mapping to NOMIS

categoryCode.description: The NOMIS REFERENCE_CODES.CODE (DOMAIN = 'INT_SCH_RSN') value for mapping to NOMIS

tier.description: The tier for this appointment, as defined by the Future Prison Regime team

customName.description:
Free text name further describing the appointment series. Used as part of the appointment name with the
    format "Custom name (Category description) if specified.

internalLocationId.description:
The NOMIS AGENCY_INTERNAL_LOCATIONS.INTERNAL_LOCATION_ID value for mapping to NOMIS.
    Will be null if in cell = true

inCell.description:
Flag to indicate if the location of the appointment series is in cell rather than an internal prison location.
    Internal location id should be null if in cell = true

startDate.description: The date of the first appointment in the series

startTime.description: The starting time of the appointment or appointments in the series

endTime.description: The end time of the appointment or appointments in the series

schedule.description:
Describes the schedule of the appointment series i.e. how the appointments in the series repeat. The frequency of
    those appointments and how many appointments there are in total in the series.
    If null, the appointment series has only one appointment. Note that the presence of this property does not mean
    there is more than one appointment as a number of appointments value of one is valid.

extraInformation.description:
Extra information for the prisoner or prisoners attending the appointment or appointments in the series.
    Shown only on the appointments details page and on printed movement slips. Wing staff will be notified there is
    extra information via the unlock list.
extraInformation.example: This appointment will help adjusting to life outside of prison

prisonerExtraInformation.description:
Prisoner extra information for the prisoner or prisoners attending the appointment or appointments.
    Shown only on the appointments details page and on printed movement slips. Wing staff will be notified there is
    prisoner extra information via the unlock list.

createdTime.description: The date and time this appointment series was created. Will not change

createdBy.description:
The username of the user authenticated via HMPPS auth that created the appointment series.
    Usually a NOMIS username

updatedTime.description:
The date and time one or more appointments in this series was last changed.
    Will be null if no appointments in the series have been altered since they were created

updatedBy.description:
The username of the user authenticated via HMPPS auth that last edited one or more appointments in this series.
    Will be null if no appointments in the series have been altered since they were created

appointments.description:
The individual appointment or appointments in this series. Non recurring appointment series will have a single
    appointment containing the same property values as the parent appointment series. The same start date, time
    and end time. Recurring appointment series will have one or more appointments. The first in the series will also
    contain the same property values as the parent appointment series and subsequent appointments will have start dates
    following on from the original start date incremented as specified by the series' schedule. Each appointment
    can be edited independently of the parent. All properties of an appointment are separate to those of the parent
    appointment series. The full series of appointments specified by the schedule will have been created in advance.

dpsLocationId.description: The optional DPS location UUID for this appointment series

AppointmentSeriesSchedule.description:
Describes the schedule of the appointment i.e. how the appointments in the series will repeat. The frequency of
  those appointments and how many appointments there will be in total in the series.

numberOfAppointments.description:
The original total number of appointments in the appointment series i.e. the number that were created initially
    without excluding any that were subsequently cancelled or deleted

ActivityScheduleLite.description:
Describes the weekly schedule for an activity. There can be several of these defined for one activity.
  An activity schedule describes when, during the week, an activity will be run and where.
  e.g. Tuesday PM and Thursday AM - suitable for Houseblock 2 to attend.
  e.g. Monday AM and Thursday PM - suitable for Houseblock 3 to attend.
  this 'lite' version of ActivitySchedule does not have allocated or instances.

Describes a slot for an activity schedule. There can be several of these defined for one activity schedule.
  An activity schedule slot describes when, during the week, an activity will be run.

AppointmentInstance.description:
Represents an appointment instance for a specific prisoner to attend at the specified location, date and time.
  The fully denormalised representation of the appointment series, appointments and attendees equivalent to a row in
  the NOMIS OFFENDER_IND_SCHEDULES table.
  Appointment instances do not exist as database records and are the product of the join between appointment attendees,
  appointments and appointment series. 
  The appointment attendee id is used for the appointment instance id as there is a one to one relationship between an
  appointment attendee and appointment instances.
  Appointment instances are used primarily for the one way sync to NOMIS.

id.description:
The internally generated identifier for this appointment instance. N.B. this is the appointment attendee id due to
    there being a one to one relationship between an appointment attendee and appointment instances.

AppointmentSearchRequest.description: The search parameters to use to filter appointments

appointmentType.description:
The appointment type (INDIVIDUAL or GROUP) to match with the appointment series. Will restrict the search results to
    appointments that are part of a series with the matching type when this search parameter is supplied.

startDate.description:
The start date to match with the appointments. Will restrict the search results to appointments
    that have the matching start date when this search parameter is supplied but no end date is supplied.
    When an end date is also supplied, the search uses a date range and will restrict the search results to
    appointments that have a start date within the date range.

endDate.description:
When an end date is supplied alongside the start date, the search uses a date range and will restrict the search results to
    appointments that have a start date within the date range.

timeSlots.description:
The time slot to match with the appointments. Will restrict the search results to appointments that have a start
    time between the times defined by the prison for that time slot when this search parameter is supplied.

categoryCode.description:
The NOMIS reference code to match with the appointments. Will restrict the search results to appointments
    that have the matching category code when this search parameter is supplied.

internalLocationId.description:
The NOMIS internal location id to match with the appointments. Will restrict the search results to
    appointments that have the matching internal location id when this search parameter is supplied.

dpsLocationId.description:
The DPS location UUID to match with the appointments. Will restrict the search results to
    appointments that have the matching location UUID when this search parameter is supplied.

inCell.description:
The in cell flag value to match with the appointments. Will restrict the search results to appointments
    that have the matching in cell value when this search parameter is supplied.

prisonerNumbers.description:
The allocated prisoner or prisoners to match with the appointments. Will restrict the search results to
    appointments that have the at least one of the supplied prisoner numbers attending when this search parameter
    is supplied.

createdBy.description:
The username of the user authenticated via HMPPS auth to match with the appointments. Will restrict the
    search results to appointments that were created by this username when this search parameter is supplied.

AppointmentAttendeeSummary.description:
Described on the UI as an "Attendee". A prisoner attending a specific appointment in an appointment series or set.
  Contains the limited summary information needed to display the prisoner information and whether they attended or not.

id.description:
The internally generated identifier for this prisoner attending a specific appointment in an appointment series or set.
    N.B. this is used as the appointment instance id due to there being a one to one relationship between an appointment
    attendee and appointment instances.

prisoner.description: Summary of the prisoner attending the appointment

attended.description:
Specifies whether the prisoner attended the specific appointment in an appointment series or set.
    A null value means that the prisoner's attendance has not been recorded yet.

attendanceRecordedTime.description:
The latest date and time attendance was recorded. Note that attendance records can be updated and this is the most
    recent date and time it was recorded. A null value means that the prisoner's attendance has not been recorded yet.

attendanceRecordedBy.description:
The username of the user that last recorded attendance. Note that attendance records can be updated and this is the
    most recent user that marked attendance. A null value means that the prisoner's attendance has not been recorded yet.

AppointmentDetails.description:
Described on the UI as an "Appointment" and represents the scheduled event on a specific date and time.
  Contains the full details of all the appointment properties and the summary collection of prisoners attending this appointment.
  An appointment is part of either a series of an appointments on a schedule or a set of appointments on the same day.
  The summary information of which appointment collection they are part of is included in these details.
  All updates and cancellations happen at this appointment level with the parent appointment series being immutable.

id.description: The internally generated identifier for this appointment

appointmentSeries.description:
Summary of the appointment series this appointment is part of.
    Will be null if this appointment is part of a set of appointments on the same day.

appointmentSet.description:
Summary of the appointment set this appointment is part of
    Will be null if this appointment is part of a series of an appointments on a schedule.

sequenceNumber.description: The sequence number of this appointment within the appointment series

prisonCode.description: The NOMIS AGENCY_LOCATIONS.AGY_LOC_ID value for mapping to NOMIS

appointmentName.description:
The appointment's name combining the optional custom name with the category description. If custom name has been
    specified, the name format will be "Custom name (Category description)"

attendees.description:
Summary of the prisoner or prisoners attending this appointment and their attendance record if any.
    Attendees are at the appointment level to allow for per appointment attendee changes.

category.description:
The summary of the appointment's category. Can be different to the parent appointment series if this appointment
    has been edited.

tier.description: The tier for this appointment, as defined by the Future Prison Regime team

customName.description:
Free text name further describing the appointment. Used as part of the appointment name with the
    format "Custom name (Category description) if specified.

internalLocation.description:
The summary of the internal location this appointment will take place. Can be different to the parent
    appointment series if this appointment has been edited.
    Will be null if in cell = true

inCell.description:
Flag to indicate if the location of the appointment is in cell rather than an internal prison location.
    Internal location will be null if in cell = true

startDate.description: The date this appointment is taking place on

startTime.description: The starting time of this appointment

endTime.description: The end time of this appointment

isExpired.description: Indicates that this appointment has expired i.e. it's start date and time is in the past

extraInformation.description:
Extra information for the prisoner or prisoners attending this appointment.
    Shown only on the appointments details page and on printed movement slips. Wing staff will be notified there is
    extra information via the unlock list.
extraInformation.example: This appointment will help adjusting to life outside of prison

prisonerExtraInformation.description:
Prisoner extra information for the prisoner or prisoners attending the appointment or appointments.
    Shown only on the appointments details page and on printed movement slips. Wing staff will be notified there is
    prisoner extra information via the unlock list.

createdTime.description: The date and time this appointment was created. Will not change

createdBy.description: The username of the user that created this appointment

isEdited.description:
Indicates that this appointment has been independently changed from the original state it was in when
    it was created as part of an appointment series

updatedTime.description:
The date and time this appointment was last changed.
    Will be null if this appointment has not been altered since it was created

updatedBy.description:
The username of the user that last edited this appointment.
    Will be null if this appointment has not been altered since it was created

isCancelled.description: Indicates that this appointment has been cancelled

isDeleted.description: Indicates that this appointment has been deleted and removed from scheduled events.

cancelledTime.description:
The date and time this appointment was cancelled.
    Will be null if this appointment has not been cancelled

cancelledBy.description:
The username of the user who cancelled this appointment.
    Will be null if this appointment has not been cancelled

AppointmentSeriesSummary.description:
Described on the UI as an "Appointment series" and only shown for repeat appointments.
  The top level of the standard appointment hierarchy containing summary information of a limited set of the initial
  property values common to all appointments in the series as well as the count of appointments in the series.
  The properties at this level cannot be changed via the API however the child appointment property values can be changed
  independently to support rescheduling, cancelling and altered attendee lists per appointment.
  N.B. there is no collection of attending prisoners at this top level as all attendees are per appointment. This is to
  support attendee modification for each scheduled appointment and to prevent altering the past by editing attendees
  in an appointment series where some appointments have past.

id.description: The internally generated identifier for this appointment series

schedule.description:
Describes the schedule of the appointment series i.e. how the appointments in the series repeat. The frequency of
    those appointments and how many appointments there are in total in the series.
    If null, the appointment series has only one appointment. Note that the presence of this property does not mean
    there is more than one appointment as a number of appointments value of one is valid.

appointmentCount.description:
The total count of appointments in the series that have not been deleted. Counts both appointments in the past and
    those scheduled.

scheduledAppointmentCount.description: The count of the remaining scheduled appointments in the series that have not been cancelled or deleted.

AppointmentSetSummary.description:
Described on the UI as an "Appointment set" or "set of back-to-back appointments".
  Contains the limited summary information needed to display the fact that an appointment was created as part of a set.

id.description: The internally generated identifier for this appointment set

appointmentCount.description:
The number of appointments in the set that have not been deleted. Counts both appointments in the past and
    those scheduled.

scheduledAppointmentCount.description: The count of the remaining scheduled appointments in the set that have not been cancelled or deleted.

prisonerNumber.description: The NOMIS OFFENDERS.OFFENDER_ID_DISPLAY value for mapping to a prisoner record in NOMIS

bookingId.description: The NOMIS OFFENDER_BOOKINGS.OFFENDER_BOOK_ID value for mapping to a prisoner booking record in NOMIS

status.description: The prisoner's status at their current prison

prisonCode.description: The NOMIS AGENCY_LOCATIONS.AGY_LOC_ID value for mapping to NOMIS.

cellLocation.description: The prisoner's residential cell location when inside the prison.

startTime.description: The starting time of the appointment

endTime.description: The end time of the appointment

extraInformation.description:
Extra information for the prisoner or prisoners attending the appointment. Shown only on the appointments details
    page and on printed movement slips. Wing staff will be notified there is extra information via the unlock list.
extraInformation.example: This appointment will help adjusting to life outside of prison

prisonerExtraInformation.description:
Prisoner extra information for the prisoner or prisoners attending the appointment or appointments.
    Shown only on the appointments details page and on printed movement slips. Wing staff will be notified there is
    prisoner extra information via the unlock list.

  The properties at this level cannot be changed via the API.

prisonPayBand.description: The pay band id for this activity pay history

rate.description: The earning rate for one half day session for someone of this incentive level and pay band (in pence)

startDate.description: The effective start date for this pay rate

changedDetails.description: The actual change to this pay rate

changedTime.description: The date and time when this pay rate was changed

changedBy.description: The person who changed this pay rate

ActivitySchedule.description:
Describes the weekly schedule for an activity. There can be several of these defined for one activity.
  An activity schedule describes when, during the week, an activity will be run and where.
  e.g. Tuesday PM and Thursday AM - suitable for Houseblock 2 to attend.
  e.g. Monday AM and Thursday PM - suitable for Houseblock 3 to attend.

id.description: The internally-generated ID for this activity schedule

instances.description: The planned instances associated with this activity schedule

allocations.description: The list of allocated prisoners who are allocated to this schedule, at this time and location

description.description: The description of this activity schedule

suspensions.description: Indicates the dates between which the schedule has been suspended

internalLocation.description: The NOMIS internal location for this schedule

capacity.description: The maximum number of prisoners allowed for a scheduled instance of this schedule

scheduleWeeks.description: The number of weeks in the schedule

slots.description: The slots associated with this activity schedule

startDate.description: The date on which this schedule will start. From this date, any schedules will be created as real, planned instances

endDate.description: The date on which this schedule will end. From this date, any schedules will be created as real, planned instances

runsOnBankHoliday.description: Whether the schedule runs on bank holidays

updatedTime.description: The date and time when this activity schedule was updated

updatedBy.description: The person who updated this activity schedule

usePrisonRegimeTime.description: a flag to indicate if this activity is scheduled according to prison standard regime times

id.description: The internally-generated ID for this eligibility rule

code.description: The code for this eligibility rule

description.description: The description for this eligibility rule
description.example: The prisoner must be over 21 to attend

ScheduledInstance.description: Describes one instance of an activity schedule

id.description: The internally-generated ID for this scheduled instance

date.description: The specific date for this scheduled instance

startTime.description: The start time for this scheduled instance

endTime.description: The end time for this scheduled instance

cancelled.description: Flag to indicate if this scheduled instance has been cancelled since being scheduled

cancelledTime.description: Date and time this scheduled instance was cancelled (or null if not cancelled)

cancelledBy.description: The person who cancelled this scheduled instance (or null if not cancelled)

attendances.description: The attendance records for this scheduled instance

advanceAttendances.description: The list of advance attendances. payAmount and attendanceHistory will be null.

Suspension.description: Describes the period of time an activity schedule has been suspended

suspendedFrom.description: The date from which the activity schedule was suspended

suspendedUntil.description: The date until which the activity schedule was suspended. If null, the schedule is suspended indefinitely

WaitingListApplicationUpdateRequest.description: The update request with the waiting list changes

applicationDate.description:
The updated past or present date on which the waiting list application was requested.
      
      Note this cannot be after the date the waiting list application was first made.

requestedBy.description: The updated person who made the request

comments.description: The updated comments related to the waiting list request
comments.example: The prisoner has specifically requested to attend this activity

status.description: The updated status of the application. Only PENDING, APPROVED or DECLINED are allowed when updating.

PrisonPayBandUpdateRequest.description: The prison pay band to update

displaySequence.description: The order in which the pay band should be presented within a list e.g. dropdown

alias.description: The alternative text to use in place of the description e.g. Low, Medium, High

AppointmentUpdateRequest.description: The update request with the new appointment details and how to apply the update

categoryCode.description: The updated NOMIS reference code. Must exist and be active.

tierCode.description: The tier code for this appointment

organiserCode.description: The organiser code for this appointment

internalLocationId.description:
The updated NOMIS internal location id within the specified prison. This or DPS location id must be supplied if inCell is false.
    The internal location id must exist, must be within the prison specified by the prisonCode property on the
    appointment and be active.

dpsLocationId.description:
The updated DPS location id within the specified prison. This or NOMIS internal location id must be supplied if inCell is false.
      The DPS location UUID must exist, must be within the prison specified by the prisonCode property on the
      appointment and be active.

inCell.description:
Flag to indicate if the location of the appointment or appointments is in cell rather than an internal prison location.
    Internal location id will be ignored if inCell is true

startDate.description:
The updated date of the appointment. NOTE: this property specifies the start date to use along with the existing
    schedule frequency to move all appointments that will take place after the appointment when used in conjunction
    with the applyTo property

startTime.description: The updated starting time

endTime.description: The updated end time

extraInformation.description:
Updated extra information for the prisoner or prisoners attending the appointment or appointments.
    Shown only on the appointments details page and on printed movement slips. Wing staff will be notified there is
    extra information via the unlock list.
extraInformation.example: This appointment will help adjusting to life outside of prison

prisonerExtraInformation.description:
Updated prisoner extra information for the prisoner or prisoners attending the appointment or appointments.
    Shown only on the appointments details page and on printed movement slips. Wing staff will be notified there is
    prisoner extra information via the unlock list.

removePrisonerNumbers.description: The prisoner or prisoners to remove from the appointment or appointments

addPrisonerNumbers.description: The new prisoner or prisoners that will be attending the appointment or appointments

applyTo.description:
Specifies which appointment or appointments this update should apply to.
    Defaults to THIS_APPOINTMENT meaning the update will be applied to the appointment specified by the
    supplied id only.

AllocationUpdateRequest.description: The update request with the new allocation details

startDate.description: The date when the prisoner will start the activity

endDate.description: The date when the prisoner will stop attending the activity

removeEndDate.description: A flag to indicate that the allocation end date is to be removed

reasonCode.description: The reason code for the deallocation

payBandId.description: Where a prison uses pay bands to differentiate earnings, this is the pay band given to this prisoner

exclusions.description: The days and times that the prisoner is excluded from this activity's schedule. All values must match a slot where the activity is scheduled to run, and due to sync to nomis, there can not not be exclusions defined on the same day and time slot over multiple weeks.

scheduleInstanceId.description: The scheduled instance id required when allocation starts today

ActivityUpdateRequest.description: The update request with the new activity details

tierCode.description: The tier code for this activity, as defined by the Future Prison Regime team

organiserCode.description: The organiser code for this activity

summary.description: A brief summary description of this activity for use in forms and lists

startDate.description: The date on which this activity will start. From this date, any schedules will be created as real, planned instances

endDate.description: The date on which this activity ends. From this date, there will be no more planned instances of the activity. If null, the activity has no end date and will be scheduled indefinitely.

runsOnBankHoliday.description: Whether the schedule runs on bank holidays

capacity.description: The maximum number of prisoners allowed for a scheduled instance of this schedule

riskLevel.description: The most recent risk assessment level for this activity

dpsLocationId.description: The optional DPS location UUID for this schedule

inCell.description: Flag to indicate if the location of the activity is in cell

onWing.description: Flag to indicate if the location of the activity is on wing

offWing.description: Flag to indicate if the location of the activity is off wing and not in a listed location

pay.description: The list of pay rates that can apply to this activity. Must be null or empty if the activity is unpaid

payChange.description: The list of pay rates that can apply to this activity. Must be null or empty if the activity is unpaid

scheduleWeeks.description: The number of weeks in the schedule

slots.description: The days and times an activity schedule can take place

paid.description: Flag to indicate if the activity is a paid activity or not. If true then pay rates are required, if false then no pay rates should be provided. Cannot be updated if already allocated.

  The system of record for internal locations is NOMIS and they are managed in that application.

AppointmentAttendeeByStatus.description: attendee and appointment details for a given status, ie not records

AppointmentAttendanceSummary.description:
Contains the summary information of a limited set the appointment properties along with counts of appointment attendance
  records. Supports management level views of appointment attendance and statistics.

id.description: The internally generated identifier for this appointment

prisonCode.description: The NOMIS AGENCY_LOCATIONS.AGY_LOC_ID value for mapping to NOMIS

appointmentName.description:
The appointment's name combining the optional custom name with the category description. If custom name has been
    specified, the name format will be "Custom name (Category description)"

internalLocation.description: The summary of the internal location this appointment will take place. Will be null if in cell = true

inCell.description: Flag to indicate if the location of the appointment is in cell

startDate.description: The date this appointment is taking place on

startTime.description: The starting time of this appointment

endTime.description: The end time of this appointment

isCancelled.description: Indicates that this appointment has been cancelled

attendeeCount.description: The number of attendees for this appointment

attendedCount.description: The number of attendees recorded as having attended this appointment

nonAttendedCount.description: The number of attendees recorded as having not attended this appointment

notRecordedCount.description: The number of attendees whose attendance has not yet been recorded

attendees.description:
The prisoner or prisoners attending this appointment. Appointments of type INDIVIDUAL will have one
    prisoner attending each appointment. Appointments of type GROUP can have more than one prisoner
    attending each appointment

AppointmentSetDetails.description:
Described on the UI as an "Appointment set" or "set of back-to-back appointments".
  Contains the full details of the initial property values common to all appointments in the set for display purposes.
  The properties at this level cannot be changed via the API.

id.description: The internally generated identifier for this appointment set

prisonCode.description: The NOMIS AGENCY_LOCATIONS.AGY_LOC_ID value for mapping to NOMIS

appointmentName.description:
The appointment set's name combining the optional custom name with the category description. If custom name has been
    specified, the name format will be "Custom name (Category description)"

category.description: The summary of the category used to create the set of appointment series

customName.description:
Free text name further describing the appointment set. Used as part of the appointment name with the
    format "Custom name (Category description) if specified.

internalLocation.description: The summary of the internal location of the appointment series in the set. Will be null if in cell = true

inCell.description:
Flag to indicate if the location of the appointment series in the set is in cell rather than an internal prison location.
    Internal location id should be null if in cell = true

startDate.description: The date of the first appointment in each appointment series in the set

appointments.description: The details of all the appointments in the the set

createdTime.description: The date and time this appointment set was created. Will not change

createdBy.description: The username of the user that created this appointment set

updatedTime.description:
The date and time one or more appointments in this set was last changed.
    Will be null if no appointments in the set have been altered since they were created

updatedBy.description:
The username of the user that last edited one or more appointments in this set.
    Will be null if no appointments in the set have been altered since they were created

AppointmentSeriesDetails.description:
Described on the UI as an "Appointment series" and only shown for repeat appointments.
  The top level of the standard appointment hierarchy containing full details of the initial property values common to
  all appointments in the series for display purposes.
  Contains the summary collection of all the child appointments in the series plus the schedule definition if the
  appointment series repeats.
  The properties at this level cannot be changed via the API however the child appointment property values can be changed
  independently to support rescheduling, cancelling and altered attendee lists per appointment.
  N.B. there is no collection of attending prisoners at this top level as all attendees are per appointment. This is to
  support attendee modification for each scheduled appointment and to prevent altering the past by editing attendees
  in an appointment series where some appointments have past.

id.description: The internally generated identifier for this appointment series

prisonCode.description: The NOMIS AGENCY_LOCATIONS.AGY_LOC_ID value for mapping to NOMIS

appointmentName.description:
The appointment series' name combining the optional custom name with the category description. If custom name has been
    specified, the name format will be "Custom name (Category description)"

category.description: The summary of the appointment series' category

tier.description: The tier for this appointment, as defined by the Future Prison Regime team

customName.description:
Free text name further describing the appointment series. Used as part of the appointment name with the
    format "Custom name (Category description) if specified.

internalLocation.description: The summary of the internal location this appointment series will take place. Will be null if in cell = true

inCell.description:
Flag to indicate if the location of the appointment series is in cell rather than an internal prison location.
    Internal location id should be null if in cell = true

startDate.description: The date of the first appointment in the series

startTime.description: The starting time of the appointment or appointments in the series

endTime.description: The end time of the appointment or appointments in the series

schedule.description:
Describes the schedule of the appointment series i.e. how the appointments in the series repeat. The frequency of
    those appointments and how many appointments there are in total in the series.
    If null, the appointment series has only one appointment. Note that the presence of this property does not mean
    there is more than one appointment as a number of appointments value of one is valid.

extraInformation.description:
Extra information for the prisoner or prisoners attending the appointment or appointments in the series.
    Shown only on the appointments details page and on printed movement slips. Wing staff will be notified there is
    extra information via the unlock list.
extraInformation.example: This appointment will help adjusting to life outside of prison

prisonerExtraInformation.description:
Prisoner extra information for the prisoner or prisoners attending the appointment or appointments.
    Shown only on the appointments details page and on printed movement slips. Wing staff will be notified there is
    prisoner extra information via the unlock list.

createdTime.description: The date and time this appointment series was created. Will not change

createdBy.description: The username of the user that created this appointment series

updatedTime.description:
The date and time one or more appointments in this series was last changed.
    Will be null if no appointments in the series have been altered since they were created

updatedBy.description:
The username of the user that last edited one or more appointments in this series.
    Will be null if no appointments in the series have been altered since they were created

appointments.description:
Summary of the individual appointment or appointments in this series both expired and scheduled.
    Non recurring appointment series will have a single appointment containing the same property values as the parent
    appointment series. The same start date, time and end time. Recurring appointment series will have one or more
    appointments. The first in the series will also contain the same property values as the parent appointment series
    and subsequent appointments will have start dates following on from the original start date incremented as specified
    by the series' schedule. Each appointment can be edited independently of the parent. All properties of an
    appointment are separate to those of the parent appointment series.
    The full series of appointments specified by the schedule will have been created in advance.

AppointmentSummary.description:
Described on the UI as an "Appointment" and represents the scheduled event on a specific date and time.
  Contains the summary information of a limited set the appointment properties. N.B. does not contain 
  information on the prisoners attending this appointment to improve API performance.
  All updates and cancellations happen at this appointment level with the parent appointment series or set being immutable.

id.description: The internally generated identifier for this appointment

sequenceNumber.description: The sequence number of this appointment within the appointment series

startDate.description: The date this appointment is taking place on

startTime.description: The starting time of this appointment

endTime.description: The end time of this appointment

isEdited.description:
Indicates that this appointment has been independently changed from the original state it was in when
    it was created as part of an appointment series

isCancelled.description: Indicates that this appointment has been cancelled

isDeleted.description: Indicates that this appointment has been deleted and removed from scheduled events.
